# API Reference for cdktf.WinrmProvisionerConnection

   WinrmProvisionerConnection <a name="WinrmProvisionerConnection" id="cdktf.WinrmProvisionerConnection"></a>
  
  Most provisioners require access to the remote resource via SSH or WinRM and expect a nested connection block with details about how to connect.
  
  See {@link https://www.terraform.io/language/resources/provisioners/connection connection}
  
  # Initializer <a name="Initializer" id="cdktf.WinrmProvisionerConnection.Initializer"></a>
  
  ```python
  import cdktf
  
  cdktf.WinrmProvisionerConnection(
    host: str,
    type: str,
    cacert: str = None,
    https: bool = None,
    insecure: bool = None,
    password: str = None,
    port: typing.Union[int, float] = None,
    script_path: str = None,
    timeout: str = None,
    use_ntlm: bool = None,
    user: str = None
  )
  ```
  
  # Properties <a name="Properties" id="Properties"></a>
  
  | **Name** | **Type** | **Description** |
  | --- | --- | --- |
  | <code><a href="#cdktf.WinrmProvisionerConnection.property.host">host</a></code> | <code>str</code> | The address of the resource to connect to. |
  | <code><a href="#cdktf.WinrmProvisionerConnection.property.type">type</a></code> | <code>str</code> | The connection type. |
  | <code><a href="#cdktf.WinrmProvisionerConnection.property.cacert">cacert</a></code> | <code>str</code> | The CA certificate to validate against. |
  | <code><a href="#cdktf.WinrmProvisionerConnection.property.https">https</a></code> | <code>bool</code> | Set to true to connect using HTTPS instead of HTTP. |
  | <code><a href="#cdktf.WinrmProvisionerConnection.property.insecure">insecure</a></code> | <code>bool</code> | Set to true to skip validating the HTTPS certificate chain. |
  | <code><a href="#cdktf.WinrmProvisionerConnection.property.password">password</a></code> | <code>str</code> | The password to use for the connection. |
  | <code><a href="#cdktf.WinrmProvisionerConnection.property.port">port</a></code> | <code>typing.Union[int, float]</code> | The port to connect to. |
  | <code><a href="#cdktf.WinrmProvisionerConnection.property.scriptPath">script_path</a></code> | <code>str</code> | The path used to copy scripts meant for remote execution. |
  | <code><a href="#cdktf.WinrmProvisionerConnection.property.timeout">timeout</a></code> | <code>str</code> | The timeout to wait for the connection to become available. |
  | <code><a href="#cdktf.WinrmProvisionerConnection.property.useNtlm">use_ntlm</a></code> | <code>bool</code> | Set to true to use NTLM authentication rather than default (basic authentication), removing the requirement for basic authentication to be enabled within the target guest. |
  | <code><a href="#cdktf.WinrmProvisionerConnection.property.user">user</a></code> | <code>str</code> | The user to use for the connection. |
  
  ---
  
  ## `host`<sup>Required</sup> <a name="host" id="cdktf.WinrmProvisionerConnection.property.host"></a>
  
  ```python
  host: str
  ```
  
  - *Type:* str
  
  The address of the resource to connect to.
  
  ---
  
  ## `type`<sup>Required</sup> <a name="type" id="cdktf.WinrmProvisionerConnection.property.type"></a>
  
  ```python
  type: str
  ```
  
  - *Type:* str
  
  The connection type.
  
  Valid values are "ssh" and "winrm".
  Provisioners typically assume that the remote system runs Microsoft Windows when using WinRM.
  Behaviors based on the SSH target_platform will force Windows-specific behavior for WinRM, unless otherwise specified.
  
  ---
  
  ## `cacert`<sup>Optional</sup> <a name="cacert" id="cdktf.WinrmProvisionerConnection.property.cacert"></a>
  
  ```python
  cacert: str
  ```
  
  - *Type:* str
  
  The CA certificate to validate against.
  
  ---
  
  ## `https`<sup>Optional</sup> <a name="https" id="cdktf.WinrmProvisionerConnection.property.https"></a>
  
  ```python
  https: bool
  ```
  
  - *Type:* bool
  
  Set to true to connect using HTTPS instead of HTTP.
  
  ---
  
  ## `insecure`<sup>Optional</sup> <a name="insecure" id="cdktf.WinrmProvisionerConnection.property.insecure"></a>
  
  ```python
  insecure: bool
  ```
  
  - *Type:* bool
  
  Set to true to skip validating the HTTPS certificate chain.
  
  ---
  
  ## `password`<sup>Optional</sup> <a name="password" id="cdktf.WinrmProvisionerConnection.property.password"></a>
  
  ```python
  password: str
  ```
  
  - *Type:* str
  
  The password to use for the connection.
  
  ---
  
  ## `port`<sup>Optional</sup> <a name="port" id="cdktf.WinrmProvisionerConnection.property.port"></a>
  
  ```python
  port: typing.Union[int, float]
  ```
  
  - *Type:* typing.Union[int, float]
  - *Default:* 22
  
  The port to connect to.
  
  ---
  
  ## `script_path`<sup>Optional</sup> <a name="script_path" id="cdktf.WinrmProvisionerConnection.property.scriptPath"></a>
  
  ```python
  script_path: str
  ```
  
  - *Type:* str
  
  The path used to copy scripts meant for remote execution.
  
  Refer to {@link https://www.terraform.io/language/resources/provisioners/connection#how-provisioners-execute-remote-scripts How Provisioners Execute Remote Scripts below for more details}
  
  ---
  
  ## `timeout`<sup>Optional</sup> <a name="timeout" id="cdktf.WinrmProvisionerConnection.property.timeout"></a>
  
  ```python
  timeout: str
  ```
  
  - *Type:* str
  - *Default:* 5m
  
  The timeout to wait for the connection to become available.
  
  Should be provided as a string (e.g., "30s" or "5m".)
  
  ---
  
  ## `use_ntlm`<sup>Optional</sup> <a name="use_ntlm" id="cdktf.WinrmProvisionerConnection.property.useNtlm"></a>
  
  ```python
  use_ntlm: bool
  ```
  
  - *Type:* bool
  
  Set to true to use NTLM authentication rather than default (basic authentication), removing the requirement for basic authentication to be enabled within the target guest.
  
  Refer to Authentication for Remote Connections in the Windows App Development documentation for more details.
  
  ---
  
  ## `user`<sup>Optional</sup> <a name="user" id="cdktf.WinrmProvisionerConnection.property.user"></a>
  
  ```python
  user: str
  ```
  
  - *Type:* str
  - *Default:* root
  
  The user to use for the connection.
  
  ---
